ExpressRoute

Dedicated private network fiber connections to Azure

1RMB Trial Buy Now

ExpressRoute is a service that enables you to create a private connection between Azure Datacenters and your on-premises or co-located infrastructure. ExpressRoute connections do not go over the public Internet, and are more reliable, faster, and more secure, with lower latency compared with typical connections over the Internet.

The private connection between the ExpressRoute service and Azure can be established through the ExpressRoute connection service provider. Customers can choose a pricing plan based on their own needs: an unlimited data plan or a metered data plan. The costs associated with these two plans are different. The cost of 2 ports (on 2 routers) is included in the monthly price to provide redundancy.

ExpressRoute Premium Add-on

ExpressRoute Premium is an add-on over the ExpressRoute Unlimited Data Plan/Metered Data Plan Charges. Customers will be able to get more routing tables and support from Azure, and use the Chinese Azure network to connect to different regions. The ExpressRoute Premium Add-on provides the following features:

  • Increased route limits for public and private peering from 4,000 routes to 10,000 routes.
  • Increased number of VNets that can be connected to an ExpressRoute circuit(the default value is 10).
  • Connect China North and China East through the Azure Core Network. You can now use a regional ExpressRoute circuit to link VNets in another region. Example: you can link a VNet created in China North to an ExpressRoute circuit created in China East.

For more details, please refer to the ExpressRoute Service Documentation page.

FAQs

Expand all
  • What additional fees will other parties charge me for in this solution?

    The ExpressRoute connection service provider will charge you extra fees. Please contact your network connection service provider for pricing information.

  • How many ports are included in the monthly fee for ExpressRoute?

    For the purpose of redundancy, 2 ports are included in the monthly fee as shown (on 2 routers).

  • If I connect to one of China's ExpressRoute locations (such as China East), can I access other areas in China via ExpressRoute?

    Yes. After connecting to one of China's ExpressRoute locations (such as China East), you can purchase ExpressRoute's advanced services (to be launched in the near future) to access other regions in China via ExpressRoute.

  • Can I connect to any Azure regions from a given ExpressRoute location?

    No. ExpressRoute in China can only be connected to regions within China. You cannot access Azure services in other countries through ExpressRoute in China.

  • Can I set up multiple circuits in my account? If so, what do I need to do?

    If you are using Azure based on an Enterprise agreement with 21Vianet, please contact our data setup team to ensure correct setup.

  • If I use ExpressRoute during a certain period of a month, will I be charged at a different rate?

    If your ExpressRoute service is valid for the entire month, you will be charged at the monthly rate, regardless of how you use it. However, if you cancel the ExpressRoute service during the month, you will only be charged for the port charges for the hours of service you used, as well as the cost of the data transfer that occurred during the month in which the service was cancelled.

  • When does the billing for ExpressRoute start and stop?

    The ExpressRoute fee will begin to be calculated upon the issuance of the service key to the customer, and the charge will cease after the following conditions: (1) The customer requests a circuit to be deleted, (2) The ExpressRoute connection provider has cancelled the circuit.

  • Can I change the port speed during a month?

    Yes, you can change the port speed at any time. However, up to 24 hours of downtime may occur when you demand the change.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support to select self-service or any other methods to contact us for support.

We guarantee at least 99.9% availability of ExpressRoute private lines. To learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
